name: Intern vs. The Firewall
description: A well-meaning but dangerously overconfident intern wreaks havoc in your network. Can you undo the damage before the auditors arrive?

steps.title: New Intern Onboarding
steps.description: The intern, Chad, has arrived. He introduces himself as 'certified in YouTube tutorials.' What do you do first?
options: Give him admin access to make him feel trusted
Assign him a read-only test account with no production access
Let him shadow the CISO for 'real learning'

steps.title: Firewall Incident
steps.description: Chad tries to 'optimize network flow' by deleting what he calls 'redundant firewall rules.' What’s your next move?
options: Disconnect the machine and notify SecOps
Ask him to restore from the mysterious backup he made

steps.title: The Slack Breach
steps.description: Chad pastes production AWS keys into a public Slack channel labeled #memes. What do you do?
options: Laugh it off — it’s in #memes, no one reads that
Panic silently while rotating all credentials
Reply with a “This is fine” GIF

steps.title: The Print Nightmare
steps.description: Chad sends 4,000 pages of Rick Astley lyrics to the network printer as a 'harmless prank.' Users can't print now. What’s the fix?
options: Unplug the printer and hold a moment of silence
Wipe the spooler queue and apply print quotas
Make him read all 4,000 pages aloud as punishment

steps.title: Shadow IT Strikes
steps.description: Chad installs an AI assistant called 'HackGPT' to help automate red team tasks. It begins probing internal ports. Your move?
options: Schedule a 1:1 to talk about ethics and firewalls
Contain the device and investigate for backdoors
Rename it to 'HelpfulBot' and hope no one notices
